name: places/ChIJpaxZnKRZwokRCPtV5DWaE50
formattedAddress: 208 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 208 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Comedy club with emerging & established talent, classes in writing/performing & limited food menu.

originalText.text:
Excellent value, we bought tickets last minute on the night of, and managed to get pretty good seats. Drinks were good and the snack food options were a good extra.
Saw some great new talent, and were last minute surprised by Jerry Seinfeld and dum Gaffigan!! They were clearly trying our new material which was cool to see the process of. But the other comedians were excellent!

Like many other reviews state- and I. At first thought maybe they were being dramatic- but now having experienced it myself- the seats  are wildly uncomfortable. üòÖ

originalText.text: Gotham is one of the most famous comedy clubs in New York. Every week, well-known and new faces take to the stage. I recommend buying a ticket online in advance. The prices for food on site are above average. I recommend eating outside in advance and only buying drinks in the club itself. The team is very friendly and professional.

text.text: Gotham is one of the most famous comedy clubs in New York. Every week, well-known and new faces take to the stage. I recommend buying a ticket online in advance. The prices for food on site are above average. I recommend eating outside in advance and only buying drinks in the club itself. The team is very friendly and professional.

originalText.text: My overall experience was "meh". I bought a last minute ticket when I was at a bar down the street and had some time to kill. The ticket price was cheap...appropriately so. The staff was very kind, but the drinks were incredibly overpriced and poorly made. The seating is old and pretty uncomfortable. They have 2-top tables with the intention of cramming 4 people around each. I'm all for the NY experience and having little personal-space, but the lack of space in this one is unreasonable. Everyone looked very uncomfortable, and the staff/patrons kept tripping over the chairs - both unsafe and super distracting during the sets. This particular show was a "New Talent Showcase," so I didn't have high expectations for the material, but the show overall was decent. The host, Dave, was good. Energy and attitudes were high. I would give it a second chance with all these variables considered only if I was there to support a specific friend/comic.

originalText.text: Was in town for the holidays and had a friend close a show. The first comedy show I've been to where the host was funny. Lol had a great time. Wasn't a bad seat in the house.  Found parking in front of the venue! NOT A FAN OF THE 2 DRINKS PER PERSON. most expensive cheap water I've ever had!  The comedians were great!
